title: Tuesday Briefing: Elite Chinese Generals Ousted
description: Also, South Korea relocates an international scout convention as a typhoon looms.

title: Foreign Ministers of China and Russia Confer Phone After Jeddah Talks
description: China underscored its desire to “actively promote” efforts to end the war in Ukraine “on any multilateral occasion.”

title: Gaza Protests Struggle to Gain Traction as Police Crack Down
description: Demonstrators’ efforts to rally against Hamas, including at protests on Monday, have been foiled by a heavy security presence.

title: UK Moves First Group of Migrants to Barge
description: A small group of migrants were transferred to the Bibby Stockholm, a divisive symbol of the Conservative government’s immigration stance.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Saudi Conference Likely to Yield Another Round of Talks
description: While Ukraine had not expected a peace deal to be reached, it was an opportunity to talk directly to allies of Russia, including China.

title: Ukraine Replaces the Soviet Symbol on the Motherland Monument
description: The Motherland Monument — a 335-foot-tall stainless steel behemoth towering over Ukraine’s capital — was unveiled in 1981 and designed to assert Soviet invincibility.

title: South Korea Tells Scouts to Quit World Jamboree Site as Typhoon Nears
description: The main campsite for the troubled gathering will be packed up and thousands of scouts will disperse across the country until the event ends on Saturday.

title: Ukraine’s Marines Urge Patience With Counterattack Against Russia
description: Journalists from The Times spent two weeks with troops from brigades trained and supplied by NATO to get their take on how, and where, the counteroffensive is going.

title: South Korean Cities Play Matchmaker to Singles Wanting to Mingle
description: Singles are signing up in droves for city-hosted blind-dating events, but some point to their inability to address real issues with family planning.

title: Turmoil in China’s Military Leads Xi to Redouble Quest for Control
description: Xi Jinping, China’s leader, set out to clean up the military a decade ago. But now his crown jewel, the missile force, is under a shadow.

title: Israeli Missile Strike Kills 4 Near Damascus, Syria Says
description: A report in Syrian state media said the attack had come from the Golan Heights. The four killed were soldiers, it said.
